meanings.definition: The act of spending the summer in a dormant state, typically to avoid extreme heat.
meanings.sent1: During estivation, the desert tortoise buries itself to stay cool.
meanings.sent2: Many animals practice estivation to survive the hot summer months.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat joked that its long nap was actually estivation.
meanings.sent4: The town seemed deserted, as if it were in a perpetual state of estivation.
meanings.sent5: Estivation is like a summer hibernation for some creatures.

meanings.definition: The state of dormancy during the summer months.
meanings.sent1: The garden remained quiet during the estivation of the plants.
meanings.sent2: Estivation helps some animals conserve energy in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The estivation of the bear made it miss all the summer picnics.
meanings.sent4: The city park felt like it was in estivation, with no one around.
meanings.sent5: The estivation of the trees made the landscape seem still and peaceful.

meanings.definition: To spend the summer in a state of torpor or inactivity.
meanings.sent1: The lizard will estivate under a rock until the heat subsides.
meanings.sent2: Some animals estivate to conserve energy when food is scarce.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could estivate like a bear and sleep through the summer.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to estivate in the summer sun, its windows closed.
meanings.sent5: Estivating in a hammock sounds like the perfect way to spend summer days.
